text: this is the far west side of Manhattan
in front of you the Hudson Yards
redevelopment is underway but in the
1940s the developer William Zeckendorf
had a different vision for this part of
town he wanted to build this massive
Airport 200 feet above the street level
with three runways now take a look at
Grand Central Terminal in the 1950s the
city considered demolishing Yale to
replace it with a skyscraper in 1956
I am Pei proposed this tower the
hyperboloid with an unprecedented design
it was meant to be taller than the
Empire State Building an exhibition at
the Queens Museum called never built New
York showcases hundreds of these
projects and allows visitors to explore
the city that never was for better or
for worse the museum even updated its
panorama of the city with a number of
these projects some were doomed by
economic crisis others by political
opposition and few just belong more to
architectural utopia than reality this
is the East River now look at a very
different design for the Manhattan
Bridge in 1925 Raymond hurt imagined a
type of bridge spanning 10,000 feet and
supported by 60 story residential towers
a sort of skyscraper bridge to be
replicated around the city
